response.overview: Digital Camouflage is a Multi-Channel Video Art Installation that was shot, curated, and edited by Alfred Bordallo. Reimagining and presenting the ways in which CHamoru people have resisted and existed under american imperialism, Digital Camouflage bears witness to the obscured, yet overt, processes through which in the wake of WWII, the means through which Guam has been further militarized as a possession of the United States. Bearing witness to the countless ways in which CHamoru people interact with and experience imperialism.
response.title: Digital Camouflage
